snippet.textDisplay:
This is one of those songs that I've listened to so much- and one of those games that's been discussed so much- that I've become jaded. For some reason, however, listening to this song, right now, with the particular image you chose to accompany it for the video, really brought memories of this game back. ASGORE is my favorite song in the game, but this is probably my favorite moment, and seeing this song here enabled me to relive that. 
I feel like UNDERTALE's explosive popularity has colored the game for me. There's something about seeing it everywhere like Minecraft or Minions that demeans the game in my memory. I feel as though it is an experience that I am no longer privy to, and I have to share it with legions of internet popular culture drones. It's difficult to maintain the integrity of your own thoughts when you're surrounded with thousands of strident voices. Perhaps there is nothing wrong with people talking about things they liked, but I myself felt that I appreciated the game more retrospectively when it wasn't yet popular culture.
snippet.textOriginal:
This is one of those songs that I've listened to so much- and one of those games that's been discussed so much- that I've become jaded. For some reason, however, listening to this song, right now, with the particular image you chose to accompany it for the video, really brought memories of this game back. ASGORE is my favorite song in the game, but this is probably my favorite moment, and seeing this song here enabled me to relive that. 
I feel like UNDERTALE's explosive popularity has colored the game for me. There's something about seeing it everywhere like Minecraft or Minions that demeans the game in my memory. I feel as though it is an experience that I am no longer privy to, and I have to share it with legions of internet popular culture drones. It's difficult to maintain the integrity of your own thoughts when you're surrounded with thousands of strident voices. Perhaps there is nothing wrong with people talking about things they liked, but I myself felt that I appreciated the game more retrospectively when it wasn't yet popular culture.

snippet.textDisplay: +真Morloki If u like puzzle games (probably since u loved fez) I recommend Antichamber and Braid.  If you like hard as hell platformer/with instant reset type games try out Super meat boy & Dustforce (both have ridiculously good OST too).  For a criminally under-known Metroid-vania style game (with a great RPG quality plot) try out Valdis Story Abyssal City.  Also VVVVVV is a fun short game with an AMAZING bit-style OST.
snippet.textOriginal: +真Morloki If u like puzzle games (probably since u loved fez) I recommend Antichamber and Braid.  If you like hard as hell platformer/with instant reset type games try out Super meat boy & Dustforce (both have ridiculously good OST too).  For a criminally under-known Metroid-vania style game (with a great RPG quality plot) try out Valdis Story Abyssal City.  Also VVVVVV is a fun short game with an AMAZING bit-style OST.

snippet.textDisplay: +L McD I disagree about any part of Undertale being made shorter, also the waterfall area is a lot of people's favorite area as it really hits home the true nature of the monsters situation... The real problem is that many people play through the game at least 3 ++ times and as interesting as each path is many parts are going to end up feeling like a grind.  I've never heard anyone complain about the length on the first play through (other then that it's too short), have you?

snippet.textDisplay:
The stand out tracks and best versions to me are:
Bonetrousle - original
Ghost Battle - dual mix
Spider Dance- dual mix
Death by Glamour - dual mix
Spear of Justice - dual mix
Battle Against a True Hero - dual mix
Asgore - original
Hopes & Dreams - original
Megalovania - original

Gooseworx versions of Spider Dance, Bonetrousle and Death by Glamour are really good, too, not to mention art in the vids are pretty entertaining.
Also Iwannabethecollector "Hopes and Dreams/Save the World/His theme" vid has the most heart wrenching Undertale art I've seen at 1:40 and 3:56

snippet.textDisplay: Generally, the more vocal someone is about the game, the more obnoxious they seem to get, at least on YouTube and similar communities which have a lot of gamers. It's like they can't appreciate it on their own without letting everyone know how big of a fan they are. There's nothing wrong with discussing the game with other fans. Just when that devolves into mindless circle-jerking and vapid fanaticism over how cool a certain character is, the discussions lose a lot of their focus and just become the raging wankfests that we hate the more obnoxious Homestuck, Steven Universe and My Little Pony fans for.
snippet.textOriginal: Generally, the more vocal someone is about the game, the more obnoxious they seem to get, at least on YouTube and similar communities which have a lot of gamers. It's like they can't appreciate it on their own without letting everyone know how big of a fan they are. There's nothing wrong with discussing the game with other fans. Just when that devolves into mindless circle-jerking and vapid fanaticism over how cool a certain character is, the discussions lose a lot of their focus and just become the raging wankfests that we hate the more obnoxious Homestuck, Steven Universe and My Little Pony fans for.

snippet.textDisplay:
Great pick. :) I especially love how it remixes some of the most bare-bone melodies of the game (Once Upon A Time, Your Best Friend, and Shop) to create a pretty awesome melody for this encounter.
Personally I'm a bit disappointed by the "best" ending of the game, but only in how the mechanics and general plot resolution have become very predictable. I absolutely love the story and I respect the boldness with which Undertale tackles some pretty heavy topics. I may have only played it for a few hours, but I've been talking about it for much, much longer. Splendid work!

My personal favorite themes from this game are:
Heartache
sans.
Bonetrousle
NGAHHH!
Metal Crusher
Spider Dance
ASGORE
Megalovania
There are so many more great songs from this soundtrack! I just adore all the creativity, different styles, and strong melodies!
snippet.textOriginal:

snippet.textDisplay:
+Maxo14 What's wrong with the fanbase? I get the sense that a lot of the players, especially younger ones, miss out on the meta-commentary that the came has about how/why we play video games to begin with. That's pretty unfortunate, but hey, the jokes about spaghetti and determination are kind of funny too I guess. Maybe people will catch on to the deeper point that the game is making  when they get a little older or more reflective.

That said, the over hyping that the fan base has done, and generally spoiling the fact that there are multiple "routes" is definitely disappointing. It really robs other people of the organic experience of the game, which is really when it is at its best.
snippet.textOriginal:
+Maxo14 What's wrong with the fanbase? I get the sense that a lot of the players, especially younger ones, miss out on the meta-commentary that the came has about how/why we play video games to begin with. That's pretty unfortunate, but hey, the jokes about spaghetti and determination are kind of funny too I guess. Maybe people will catch on to the deeper point that the game is making  when they get a little older or more reflective.

That said, the over hyping that the fan base has done, and generally spoiling the fact that there are multiple "routes" is definitely disappointing. It really robs other people of the organic experience of the game, which is really when it is at its best.

This is probably my favourite song from the game - it plays at such a great time and, as played out as saying this is, it filled me with determination.

Hoping to see other songs from Undertale here such as SAVE the World, Undertale, Last Goodbye, Fallen Down (Reprise)...and still many more. What a great and impressive soundtrack!

snippet.textOriginal: Great pick! The music combined with the visuals made the fight completely unforgettable.

snippet.textDisplay: For quite some time, this was my favorite game of the year. Even now, it's extremely close behind my #1. I can't help but be amazed by Toby Fox for creating this game: hybrid RPG/bullet hell battle system, the option to be passive or agressive against your opponents, a story reflecting your choices in a truly different way. But to me, the biggest highlights are the cast of characters (Sans and Papyrus are my favorites) and the soundtrack which is easily my favorite of the year. If I had to identify some flaws for me, it would be that the middle section doesn't keep up with the superb beginning (including the whole section with Sans and Papyrus) and ending sections of the game. I also think the battle system, when playing passively, could have been fleshed out in a way that needs more strategy. For example, there could be more cues to what you should say to your oponent and more penalties when you say something that has no effect, as I'd often find myself simply testing everything until I find the right sequence. I also don't see myself ever replaying it now that I've gone through the 3 endings. Still, this is a great gaming experience that I'll probably never forget, and I feel like the ending(s) really helped elevate it to the already "classic" status it has. On a side note, it's been especially fun to see other people play this game for the first time, great reactions!
snippet.textOriginal: For quite some time, this was my favorite game of the year. Even now, it's extremely close behind my #1. I can't help but be amazed by Toby Fox for creating this game: hybrid RPG/bullet hell battle system, the option to be passive or agressive against your opponents, a story reflecting your choices in a truly different way. But to me, the biggest highlights are the cast of characters (Sans and Papyrus are my favorites) and the soundtrack which is easily my favorite of the year. If I had to identify some flaws for me, it would be that the middle section doesn't keep up with the superb beginning (including the whole section with Sans and Papyrus) and ending sections of the game. I also think the battle system, when playing passively, could have been fleshed out in a way that needs more strategy. For example, there could be more cues to what you should say to your oponent and more penalties when you say something that has no effect, as I'd often find myself simply testing everything until I find the right sequence. I also don't see myself ever replaying it now that I've gone through the 3 endings. Still, this is a great gaming experience that I'll probably never forget, and I feel like the ending(s) really helped elevate it to the already "classic" status it has. On a side note, it's been especially fun to see other people play this game for the first time, great reactions!

snippet.textDisplay: +SupraDarky Honestly, I'm REALLY sick of this game by now. I highly doubt that it will become such a classic and that many will care about it in 10 years. Hell, even when I loved Undertale (back when I actually played it) I thought that many people horribly overrate it. And with how many great came out this year (especially Wicther 3. If you have trouble caring about Witcher 2, I just advice to skip it and go straight to 3, it's a much better game.), how anybody can even put it as their GOTY is beyond me.

snippet.textDisplay: +SupraDarky Also, I think now's a good time to tell you guys some of the games I didn't play. The big 3: Witcher 3, MGS5 and Bloodborne. I still need to finish Witcher 2 and I'll be honest, I have a hard time getting drawn into this series' world and find the battle/skills system average (should I blame the Souls series?). As for MGS5, I only played a couple hours and while I find the gameplay/controls to be the best in the series, it's been a huge disappointment so far. I feel like I will like the game itself, but not as a MGS entry. Then we have Bloodborne which, honestly, might have had a big chance of being my #1 of the year, but I still want to go through Dark Souls 2 first and I don't have a PS4 yet. Another mention would be Xenoblade Chronicles X, but I'm currently playing through the first game which I'm absolutely loving so far.
